sense.name: a bouncing, light gait
sense.examples: The little girl's skip down the street was a happy sight. The dancers moved in a circle, doing a light skip. John's house is just a hop, skip and a jump from Mary's. (metaphoric extension)

sense.name: an unintentional omission which is an error
sense.examples: The noise in the engine is from an occasional skip in the combustion cycle. Bob consulted a physician about the recent skips in his heartbeat. The misspelled headline was a major skip by the newspaper editor.

sense.name: an intentional passing over a sequence of instructions
sense.examples: The logic of this program block results in a skip over all the if clauses that don't match the test condition.

sense.name: a person who defaults, e.g., on a loan
sense.examples: The man had developed a credit history as a real skip.
